node.title: COVID has now brought death into the NT. But somehow, the outbreak isn't as bad as anyone feared
node.alt: Katherine resident Lynette Hoffman, wearing a mask, looking at the camera, outside a COVID-19 testing site.
node.description: Not quite a month since the Northern Territory's worst-ever COVID outbreak began, most restrictions have been lifted and the large-scale disaster many feared would unfold has somehow been avoided â€” so far.
node.content:
["Ever since outbreaks began to rage in the southern states, and the Northern Territory remained mercifully COVID-free, authorities have been warning that the luck would one day run out.\u00a0", "We couldn't keep getting through outbreaks unscathed. A wider outbreak was unavoidable. The disease would hit remote communities. Territorians would die.", "Last month that day finally came.", "The Northern Territory has now suffered its most serious outbreak since the pandemic began, the disease finally did reach the Territory's vulnerable Indigenous communities, and a beloved elder became the first NT death from coronavirus.", "But the fears of more large-scale devastation and catastrophe have not \u2014 yet \u2014 been realised.", "The outbreak is not over yet, with\u00a0three more cases\u00a0discovered in an at-risk corner of Katherine on Friday.", "But it does appear contained, for now.", "Almost all the restrictions that were snapped into place last month have now lifted and communities that were on the edge of disaster have been\u00a0declared COVID-free.", "The chair of epidemiology at Deakin University, Professor Catherine Bennett, told the ABC it was, so far,\u00a0an \"an extraordinary story\" of collaboration between remote communities and health authorities to manage highly localised outbreaks.", "
COVID reaches the remote Territory
", "Late in the evening of November 15, a woman from the Aboriginal community of Robinson River in the Gulf of Carpentaria tested positive to coronavirus.", "She was a household contact of a Katherine man who was eventually linked to the Darwin-Katherine cluster from earlier in the month.", "It marked the first recorded time a remote Aboriginal community in the Northern Territory had been exposed to COVID-19.", "", "
Robinson River was the first remote NT community to record a COVID case.(Supplied: Sue Miller)
", "In the weeks leading up to the outbreak, the NT's Chief Medical Officer had invoked images of \"mass mortuaries\" when speaking of the threats posed by staggering\u00a0gaps in the\u00a0remote vaccine\u00a0rollout\u00a0across the Northern Territory in Aboriginal communities.\u00a0", "But Robinson River, when the virus arrived, was already one of the most inoculated communities in the Territory, with a 77 per cent single-dose vaccination rate at the time.", "Despite that, the same preventable problems with illness,\u00a0poverty and inadequate housing that have left other Aboriginal communities at greater risk to the virus exist there.", "Federal Senator Malarndirri McCarthy revealed 10 of the eventual cases in Robinson River were her family members.", "McCarthy, a Yanuwa and Garrawa woman, called what was transpiring \"a case of life and death\" as she asked: \"how can [community members] isolate when they're 15 to 20 people to a house?\"", "
Despite worst fears, disaster is averted
", "Three weeks later,\u00a0Robinson River was declared COVID-free.", "Chief Minister Michael Gunner would attribute the outcome, at least in part, to strong vaccination rates.", "Proud local elder Dickie Dickson said the same.", "\"That all comes back to my community,\" he told the ABC, as well as crediting local health workers.", "\"We've been sticking together \u2014 listening for advice, taking advice seriously [and] got vaccinated earlier.\"", "In addition, a key\u00a0intervention used during the outbreak was what the NT government called a \"vaccination surge\".", "This response saw NT Health Department staff fly immediately into the community with resources to test and vaccinate residents anyone who needed it.", "The surges, Mr Gunner said, could halve the risk of hospitalisation and deaths among remote community residents, according to modelling from\u00a0the Doherty Institute the government had received.", "This response would be replicated in other remote communities threatened by COVID-19, including Binjari and Rockhole.", "", "
Remote community residents have been flown into Darwin and taken to Howard Springs during the outbreak.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "And while\u00a0health staff were being flown in to an outbreak area, positive cases and close contacts were being flown out to the Howard Springs quarantine facility in Darwin.", "The government conceded that the long-standing issue of overcrowded housing\u00a0had put people's lives at greater risk.", "The quarantine centre that's played a key national role keeping other Australians safe during the pandemic was now helping protect remote Territorians left more vulnerable by inaction on that issue.", "
The NT's first COVID death
", "By November 20, the outbreak had leaked out of Katherine to another nearby community, with nine cases discovered in Binjari on the town's outskirts.", "Army personnel\u00a0would join to assist with food delivery and transportation to testing facilities during the outbreak.", "", "
The army was called in to help with Katherine's COVID response.(ABC News: Jesse Thompson)
", "But this time, the outbreak had hit a community designated by the NT government as \"low vaccination\", which prompted harsher lockdown restrictions.", "A 78-year-old woman was flown to Royal Darwin Hospital on that night.", "She died 13 days later.", "The Binjari elder, described as a wonderful and well-respected woman by a local leader, was the Northern Territory's first death related to COVID-19.", "", "
A police roadblock outside Binjari, where the NT's first hard lockdown was enforced.(Supplied: NT Health)
", "Infections in Binjari, a community also suffering acute overcrowding issues, resulted in multiple hospitalisations.", "Mr Gunner would go on to attribute the increased spread and severity of the disease felt in Binjari, when compared to Robinson River, to vaccination rates.", "But even with a low vaccination rate \u2014 government data indicated the rate in Binjari was below 70 per cent first dose when the virus hit \u2014 widespread death and disease did not hit the town.", "Within days, the government said first dose vaccination rates had hit 100 per cent in Binjari as well as two nearby communities.", "Authorities say high testing rates, a spike in demand for vaccinations and careful COVID-safe behaviour also helped Lajamanu avoid transmission when one case was recorded there.", "Professor Bennett said that ongoing concern stemming from\u00a0low vaccination rates in communities was mitigated by the response of the government and Aboriginal health services during the outbreaks.", "\"They boosted the vaccine with campaigns. We know even\u00a0first dose [vaccination] protects against serious illness.", "", "
Lockout restrictions were lifted in Katherine on Wednesday.(ABC News: Michael Franchi)
", "\"That vaccine security behind them is the difference between people getting very unwell, having to go to hospital or sadly losing anyone in the community.\"", "Professor Bennett acknowledged there could be some element of luck involved in the current impact of the outbreak, but she said\u00a0\"a level of awareness and community ownership of the problem meant it was contained\".", "\"Sadly, there was loss of life for the first time, but it could have been so much worse \u2026 if there hadn\u2019t been that recognition or importance of vaccine, even first dose vaccination, to manage local outbreaks,\" she said.", "
The NT remains Australia's least devastated place
", "Despite low remote vaccination rates and the long-standing fears of rampant deaths, the NT has recorded one COVID death \u2013 a number that remains the lowest in the country.", "The threat to lives during the outbreak, according to Mr Gunner, was \"extreme\".", "With case numbers currently at 67,\u00a0the current outbreak has clearly been the NT's most significant.", "And while there has been tragedy for a community, a crippling lockdown in Katherine, many Territorians, given the high stakes their political leaders have consistently told them are at play, could feel like they have again escaped the worst.", "The Northern Territory's first major outbreak, which began in a Central Australian mine and spread to four states, lead to only 17 cases and short lockdown periods.", "The second outbreak, where a man spent several days in Darwin and Katherine while infected but did not spread the virus, baffled health authorities.", "\"We do not know where he got it, and he was highly infectious and yet he did not spread it,\" Mr Gunner said.", "The Northern Territory's relative good fortune has continued. But in 2021, COVID-19 has crept through the wider community at a greatly increased rate.", "The NT recorded its 100th case of the disease in February this year.", "This week, nine months later, it recorded its 300th.", "It was also a week that Mr Gunner signalled the Northern Territory's pandemic response, long characterised by snap lockdowns and COVID eradication, had effectively changed forever.", "Suppressing the current\u00a0outbreak, he said, was \"probably impossible to achieve\".", "The NT is now days out from reopening its borders to the rest of the country, despite calls from Aboriginal groups to push the plan back into next month.", "Professor Bennett said it was critical to reinforce what has worked during the health response, rather than saying: \"we\u00a0now don't have to worry\".", "\"We were right to worry about it,\" she said.", "\"We\u2019ve also now lifted that vaccination rate, which gives\u00a0that extra level of protection against infection and critical illness.", "\"That is so important in remote settings.\"", "", "
Why we hear about some COVID-19 variants more than others
"]
